messages: 55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:35): i've a question, i added a new syntax style and it seems to work properly

55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:36): it seems it doesn't indent at all
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:36): even if the syntax is recognized
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:37): from within vim how can i set it on
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:37): let me see if it works..
c786d3023ef6f964cccc7e0e64a3befb (04:38): how do i stop vim from opening two files if I type at the command line 'vim new file' wanting a file named new file (with no connector)
89be4a7e5aece908695aa64d0cbde22f (04:38): sigma957: put quotes around the file
c786d3023ef6f964cccc7e0e64a3befb (04:38): Fyrguy: thanks. knew it had to be something simple
89be4a7e5aece908695aa64d0cbde22f (04:39): Vega___: what syntax are you doing?
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:39): Fryguy--:  where is the indent rule defined?
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:39): i need to include the syntax for NesC
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:39): i've found nc.vim for the syntax
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:39): but i've done nothing for the indentetation..
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:40): the same as the C style could be good...
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:40): but where i've to set it?
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:41): btw where can i say to do it automatically ?
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:41): for instance for the syntax i modified a file
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:41): in this case there is something similar?
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:46): goflyapig:  it seems i can simply modify the filetype in function of the file extension adding setft is it correct? :D
828997d3329f6368569d69d0d2baa3e6 (04:47): you lost me.  you can add filetype specific settings (like :set cindent) to ~/.vim/ftplugin/{filetype}.vim
828997d3329f6368569d69d0d2baa3e6 (04:49): that's probably not a good idea.  that will be replaced when you upgrade.
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:49): so every user can benefit from it
828997d3329f6368569d69d0d2baa3e6 (04:51): your distro might let you to have custom system-wide settings in some place like  /etc/vim
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:52): after to have created the right directories and put properly the files
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:52): what do i have to do?
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:52): i should have a local ftplugin.vim and filetype.vim
55954dd04550942d9da649d50d34f103 (04:53): i don't know how to write them...just copy the basic ones?
